raw: David Bowie, Adele and Beyoncé: BBC unveil Glastonbury coverage .

raw: The final weekend of June should have seen 200,000 revellers descend on Somerset for the 50th anniversary of the Glastonbury festival .
replaced: The final weekend of June should have seen 200,000 revellers descend on Somerset for the 50th anniversary of Glastonbury .

raw: With the event cancelled owing to the coronavirus pandemic , the BBC has announced extensive broadcast plans celebrating the British music institution from 25 - 29 June .
replaced: With Glastonbury cancelled owing to the coronavirus pandemic , BBC has announced extensive broadcast plans celebrating Glastonbury from 25 - 29 June .

raw: David Bowie ’s headline set , from the year 2000 , will be shown in full for the first time ever as part of the coverage across BBC Two , BBC Four and iPlayer .
replaced: David Bowie ’s headline set , from the year 2000 , will be shown in full for the first time ever as part of the coverage across BBC , BBC and iPlayer .

raw: The coverage will also feature full headline performances from Jay - Z , Beyoncé , Adele and Coldplay .
replaced: The coverage will also feature full headline performances from Jay - Z , Beyoncé , Adele and Coldplay .

raw: Glastonbury organiser Emily Eavis said : “ I ’m looking forward to a weekend of reflecting on the history of our festival and going back to some classic performances from David Bowie , Adele , REM , Beyoncé , the Rolling Stones , Jay - Z , Billie Eilish and lots more .
replaced: Glastonbury  Eavis said : “ Eavis ’m looking forward to a weekend of reflecting on the history of Glastonbury and going back to some classic performances from David Bowie , Adele , REM , Beyoncé , the Rolling Stones , Jay - Z , Billie Eilish and lots more .

raw: Me and my dad will definitely be watching . ”
replaced: Eavis and Eavis dad will definitely be watching . ”

raw: Eavis will join Lauren Laverne on the BBC Radio 6 Music morning show on 26 June .
replaced: Eavis will join Lauren Laverne on the BBC Radio 6 Music morning show on 26 June .

raw: Across three nights on BBC Two from 26 - 29 June , the BBC will celebrate memorable performances from the broadcaster ’s 23 - year partnership with the festival , including sets by Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds , REM , PJ Harvey , Baaba Maal , Amy Winehouse , Blur , Lady Gaga , Dizzee Rascal , Toots and the Maytals , Arctic Monkeys and the Rolling Stones .
replaced: Across three nights on BBC from 26 - 29 June , BBC will celebrate memorable performances from the broadcaster ’s 23 - year partnership with Glastonbury , including sets by Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds , REM , PJ Harvey , Baaba Maal , Amy Winehouse , Blur , Lady Gaga , Dizzee Rascal , Toots and the Maytals , Arctic Monkeys and the Rolling Stones .

raw: On the afternoon of Sunday 28 June , just as Diana Ross was due to perform at the festival ’s fabled legends slot , BBC Two will dedicate a programme to the venerable artists who have soothed the Sunday teatime crowd .
replaced: On the afternoon of Sunday 28 June , just as Diana Ross was due to perform at the festival ’s fabled legends slot , BBC will dedicate a programme to the venerable artists who have soothed the Sunday teatime crowd .

raw: Sixty full festival sets will be available on - demand on iPlayer , including shows by Florence and the Machine , Christine and the Queens , Lana Del Rey , Billie Eilish , Foals , the xx , The Killers , Lewis Capaldi and Radiohead ’s historic 1997 headline set , which the group famously described as “ a form of hell ” thanks to technical difficulties .

raw: A specially commissioned film , The Best of BBC Music Introducing at Glastonbury , will chronicle the major stars who played the festival ’s new music stage earlier in their careers , including Sheeran , George Ezra , Nao and Celeste .

raw: Young viewers can earn a Blue Peter music badge by performing , dancing or creating DIY festivals as part of the historic children ’s show programming on 25 - 26 June .

raw: National and local BBC radio programming will feature extensive coverage of the festival ’s history .

raw: BBC Radio 1 Xtra will reflect on historic sets by Jay - Z , Stormzy and Dave .
